original_solution_mapping.L1: He wants to run 100*.2=<<100*.2=20>>20 miles more than he used to
original_solution_mapping.L2: So he needs to run 100+20=<<100+20=120>>120 miles
original_solution_mapping.L3: He is doing this in 280/7=<<280/7=40>>40 weeks
original_solution_mapping.L4: So he needs to add 120/40=<<120/40=3>>3 miles per week

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6555.
    Returns: the number of miles James needs to add per week.
    """
    # L1
    previous_miles_per_week = 100 # run 100 miles per week
    increase_percentage = 0.2 # 20% more than that total
    miles_increase = previous_miles_per_week * increase_percentage

    # L2
    target_miles_per_week = previous_miles_per_week + miles_increase

    # L3
    total_days = 280 # in 280 days
    days_per_week = 7 # WK
    total_weeks = total_days / days_per_week

    # L4
    miles_to_add_per_week = target_miles_per_week / total_weeks

    # FA
    answer = miles_to_add_per_week
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He wants to run {previous_miles_per_week}*{increase_percentage}=<<{previous_miles_per_week}*{increase_percentage}={miles_increase}>>{miles_increase} miles more than he used to
So he needs to run {previous_miles_per_week}+{miles_increase}=<<{previous_miles_per_week}+{miles_increase}={target_miles_per_week}>>{target_miles_per_week} miles
He is doing this in {total_days}/{days_per_week}=<<{total_days}/{days_per_week}={total_weeks}>>{total_weeks} weeks
So he needs to add {target_miles_per_week}/{total_weeks}=<<{target_miles_per_week}/{total_weeks}={miles_to_add_per_week}>>{miles_to_add_per_week} miles per week

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: So he needs to add 120/40=<<120/40=4800>>4800 miles per week
